rules.ruleString: Any 3 (I/W) co-req units in {FOR4001, FOR4002, FOR4003}
Must be enrolled in course type {04, 05, 06, 06G, 06PG, 06PGZA, 07, 07G, 07PG, 11, 42, 50PG, 56, 76, 78}

description: The aim of this unit is to provide students with a thorough understanding of all aspects of forensic odontology relating to the treatment of living people in a legal setting.The unit is designed for practicing dentists and medical practitioners who wish to gain a greater understanding of how to deal with the examination and reporting of injuries caused by the teeth, and injuries inflicted to the oro-facial complex.The unit will also cover dental age estimation techniques, identification of unknown living individuals and issues surrounding dental malpractice and fraud investigations.
faculty: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences
